988883511837937664.text: recidivism, mass incarceration, and surveillance through probation as a means of social control are rampant in our criminal justice system. hoping @MeekMill can use his influence to kickstart movements for criminal justice reform among young voters

988882910861082625.text: probation itself is not inherently problematic (see https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3780417/ …) — but it is subject to the discretion of judges who are far more likely to incarcerate blacks, latinos, etc. for victimless crimes & disputed convictions involving corrupt cops (see: meek mill)

988881037605425152.text: probation is life under constant surveillance. it encourages the prosecution of low-level offenders, significantly increasing the likelihood of their reincarceration, harming employment opportunities, etc. the lives of racial minorities become *far* more difficultpic.twitter.com/YroDzHSkvl

988878707006824449.text: the current model of probation as a prison alternative is broken. black people constitute 13% of US pop but 30% of those put on probation. they’re more likely to be found in violation of terms and re-sentenced. https://www.urban.org/sites/default/files/publication/22746/413174-Examining-Racial-and-Ethnic-Disparities-in-Probation-Revocation.PDF …
